title: Jeremy A. Dubrulle Curiculum Vitae
text:
#PUT PDF at assets/Jeremy_dubrulle_Cv.pdf Download CV (PDF)



Having fun during the PhD



First & first co-author Publications

Effect of Land-Use on Hantavirus Infection Among Introduced and Endemic Small Mammals of Madagascar, Ecology and Evolution, April 2025, https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.70914
CRISPR2025 New Zealand: Innovation and Collaboration, The Crispr Journal, May 2025, https://doi.org/10.1089/crispr.2025.0026



Co-author Publications


Workshop & Conferences

Conferences attended & presented:

Queenstown Research Week:

2023: Listener only
2024: Poster on Honours’ degree work, see article here: [insert article link]
2025: 20 mins Talk

Auckland Maurice Wilkins Centre Symposium (poster on PhD project)
CRISPR2025 (Co-wrote a conference report, available at: http://dx.doi.org/10.1089/crispr.2025.0026
Ecology and Evolution of Infectious Diseases Conference 2021 (online poster) which then led to the above publication https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.70914



Workshops:

Quarto and Git reproducibility (2025, two days)
Introduction to R and Bash (2024, one week)
ggplot2 visualisation (Genomics Aotearoa, Jun 2025, one day)
Graduate Research School workshops:

Visualisation with ggplot2
R for data science 2

6 months (30hr/week) under Prof. Jemma Geoghegan, University of Otago.
1.5 year (full-time) under Prof. Pablo Tortosa, University of La Reunion.

Bats trapping on Reunion Island (Several overnight trapping missions of endemic bats)

Radio One 91 FM Live Interview on Phage Therapy
